intro: Zannichellia peltata var. repens, commonly known as the running water plant, is a submerged aquatic plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It has narrow, ribbon-like leaves that are typically arranged in whorls around the stem. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often submerged, though some may emerge above water. It thrives in slow-moving or still freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Zannichellia peltata var. repens plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
